Good Safari alternative.. When deleting website data, Safari has a well known bug where some cookies still remain.  Firefox, although not perfect, is a good alternative. The tracking protection feature is welcome (restricted to private browsing only in iOS 10) although blocking 3rd party cookies and a 'do not track' request should be added in a future release. Adding to the reading list was a bit of a faff to work out how to set it up but now works well enough. Firefox, sadly lacks the full iOS integration, thanks to Apple's restrictions and doesn't support Firefox plugins. Unlike Safari, Firefox doesn't have a website data list so we have to trust all cookies get deleted when clearing private data. Good Safari alternative but not perfect yet.

Good Safari alternative.. I am becoming continually frustrated with Safari iOS. I find a number of websites aren't working correctly that work perfectly in other iOS browsers (Netflix is one example). Also when deleting website data, Safari has a well known bug where some cookies still remain.  Firefox, although not perfect, is a good alternative. The tracking protection feature is welcome (restricted to private browsing only in iOS 10) although blocking 3rd party cookies and a 'do not track' request should be added in a future release. Adding to the reading list was a bit of a faff to work out how to set it up but now works well enough. Firefox, sadly lacks the full iOS integration, thanks to Apple's restrictions and doesn't support Firefox plugins. Unlike Safari, Firefox doesn't have a website data list so we have to trust all cookies get deleted when clearing private data. Works where Safari doesn't. Good alternative but not perfect yet.

Needs UI tweaking and Adblocking integration. Dear Mozilla,

This is a product with tons of opportunities. The custom search engine script is amazing, and finally allows me to use a custom search query for a trustworthy engine (StartPage). This finally pulls me away from the control of Google. However, some tweaks would make it a better product on iPad and iPhone:

1) Add Adblocking ability from Firefox Focus. I realize that it is no small feat as Apple does not allow Firefox iOS to use the apple scripts for Adblocking, but adopting the block lists to the fully fledged app would be a gift to all.

Update: 9/22/2017. Thank you for adding tracking protection, and at different levels! This is a huge improvement for user privacy and I commend Mozilla for continuing to fight the good fight against tracking.

2) Make bookmarks editable (renamable) and their order organizable. Currently you can only delete or open them in a new tab as options. It's not a mature feature set.

3) Move the new tab button on the tab viewing page from the bottom left to the bottom right. This keeps you from having to travel the diagonal from the tab button (upper right) to the opposite (bottom left) corner, switching hands. Useful on iPad, VERY USEFUL for iPhone use, which is often one handed.

4) the pin to top sites feature only allows one link to the domain of choice. If I want to have a link to my Amazon Orders, that will take over the general Amazon.com link. Make this more like the safari Favorites tab! There's no need to reinvent the wheel. Customization, privacy, and autonomy should be the hallmark of Firefox. Not some gimmicky, clunky suggested websites. What if I visit an illicit website and don't want to worry about it poppin up in a new tab?? I get it, use private browsing mode, but the suggested websites panel should be an option you can disable.

Lots of potential, but the app needs some streamlining and more options for the user. Apple locks us down, but Mozilla can potentially set us free.

No Adblock and no download support. It would be perfect if not for this. There are several browsers in the App Store that had native Adblock before content block apps so I'm not sure why a big gun like Firefox can't manage. It's so bad I've switched browsers until they introduce this. For downloading I'm not even asking for video support, just being able to download an ePub without having to switch to safari is enough. Again, why isn't this something that came with the original launch? Others can do it.

Good brower marred by PATHETIC Bookmark management. Good fast browser able to display sites the Safari garbage can't, that is rendered almost useless by truly abysmal bookmark management. Mozilla, you seriously need to pull your socks up with this. No folder management, no re-ordering of bookmarks, to update a bookmark you have to delete it and add it back... The entire bookmark subsystem is embarrassingly archaic.  This browser would get a MUCH higher rating if the bookmark subsystem lived up to the rest of the package.

As of September 2017 this situation has no t changed.

Bug Report. LÃ¤sst sich leider in der aktuellen Version auf dem iPhone SE nicht einmal mehr Ã¶ffnen. Die Bewertung wird selbstverstÃ¤ndlich mit Fehlerbehebung bearbeitet.

Not the best browser.. This browser doesn't replicate the experience of the desktop version. There are too few options - not enough privacy options like blocking 3rd party cookies and 'do not track' option. At least with Safari iOS, you can add a content blocker to block ads and other trackers. I like that you can set a default search engine as some mobile browsers annoyingly don't allow this. I've never been a fan of Top Sites as it displays your most visited sites rather than a fully customised set of sites. Even if you pin sites to it, there's no way to reorder them. At least with the desktop version there's the option to install a Speed Dial plugin. Overall, quite disappointing.

Ganz okay, aber teilweise Reaktion sehr langsam. Vor allem, wenn man nur mal schnell etwas nachgucken mÃ¶chte, und kurz nach dem Start des Browsers eine URL eintippen mÃ¶chte, dauert es manchmal bis zu 10 Sekunden, bis der Browser reagiert. Das muss dringend verbessert werden.

Auch verschiedene Dinge sind einfach noch nicht gut gelÃ¶st. Zum Beispiel die Lesezeichenverwaltung ist noch ein groÃŸes Manko.

Insgesamt aber bin ich glÃ¼cklich, dass ich meine umfangreiche Lesezeichensammlung und meine History jetzt auch mobil immer dabei habe.

Very Frustrating. I'm a great fan of Firefox but find their "support" extremely frustrating. There is a forum but questions there can go unanswered and from there they fall into a Firefox black hole.

This all started with me wanting to know how to create bookmark folders in the iOS app. 

Spent 1.5 hours trying to find the answers. Too bad. No one is home at Mozilla.

Needs UI tweaking and Adblocking integration. Dear Mozilla,

This is a product with tons of opportunities. The custom search engine script is amazing, and finally allows me to use a custom search query for a trustworthy engine (StartPage). This finally pulls me away from the control of Google. However, some tweaks would make it a better product on iPad and iPhone:

1) Add Adblocking ability from Firefox Focus. I realize that it is no small feat as Apple does not allow Firefox iOS to use the apple scripts for Adblocking, but adopting the block lists to the fully fledged app would be a gift to all.

2) Make bookmarks editable (renamable) and their order organizable. Currently you can only delete or open them in a new tab as options. It's not a mature feature set.

3) Move the new tab button on the tab viewing page from the bottom left to the bottom right. This keeps you from having to travel the diagonal from the tab button (upper right) to the opposite (bottom left) corner, switching hands. Useful on iPad, VERY USEFUL for iPhone use, which is often one handed.

4) the pin to top sites feature only allows one link to the domain of choice. If I want to have a link to my Amazon Orders, that will take over the general Amazon.com link. Make this more like the safari Favorites tab! There's no need to reinvent the wheel. Customization, privacy, and autonomy should be the hallmark of Firefox. Not some gimmicky, clunky suggested websites. What if I visit an illicit website and don't want to worry about it poppin up in a new tab?? I get it, use private browsing mode, but the suggested websites panel should be an option you can disable.

Lots of potential, but the app needs some streamlining and more options for the user. Apple locks us down, but Mozilla can potentially set us free.

Good & Bad. I really wish you would allow private browsing by default, and Focus is not the answer. Brave really has it down, you can turn things on and off as you wish, better control over defaults, without having to make two browsers.
I love Firefox on Desktop but the mobile version leaves me frustrated.
That said, it's pretty fast and loads some pages other mobile browsers won't.

Nice alternative. but still room for improvements

What a joke.. Cannot rename or edit bookmarks. You have to edit bookmarks from a Desktop computer, then sync them to mobile. 

No easy way to view bookmarks. Why? You cannot open bookmarks when looking at the current tab, you have to open the tab switcher, then open up a menu, then view bookmarks. Not the icon that looks like a book (no, thats the "Reading" button). The star button hidden on the popup menu hidden on the tab switcher screen is where the bookmarks are hidden. 

Also, why not have some sort of adblock? Safari and Opera both block ads, both sync bookmarks, and both let me edit bookmarks. Why would I want to use Firefox instead of Safari or Opera?

Way too cumbersome. Have been a devoted user of Firefox on Windows for years but this app is nothing like the desktop version.  Got the app so that I would have access to my bookmarks on an iPad when on the road.  Wow, what a pain!  The number of steps you have to take just to FIND your bookmarks is absurd.  Then, to switch to a different bookmark you have to go through the whole multiple step process all over again.  I will keep the app just in case I need access to a bookmark but there is no way I can use this as my 'everyday' browser.  Will continue to use Safari.

Finally found an app for modifying my eBay variations. Been looking and looking for an app that will not bug out when you confronted with JavaScript. This app works like a charm for modifying my eBay variations that used to constantly scroll on safari and other browsers.

Needs improvements in Bookmarking, history/cache settings, FF Sync, and personalization. I use Firefox as my primary browser on my laptop, tablet, and mobile device. I find the "FF Sync" useful, in that, it backups and pushes bookmarks and tabs to all my devices- It could benefit from some improvement though.

Same goes for Firefox Mobile- your bookmarking lacks organizational tools and your settings within the browser are lacking quite a bit. 

I cannot clear my regular cache/history upon closing a tab, unless it is a private tab. There is no setting where I can say "do not remember my history, etc" either. Why not? I don't know. 

Ya'll gotta get to work!

Incredible. Firefox is the best browser across all platforms. It is faster than chrome, opera, or any other browsers on the internet. It is also the most secure, simple, and respectful to your privacy. I really like the QR code scanner, and the "top sites" page that is basically a Firefox-modified version of Opera's Iconic feature, Speed Dial.

Safari is great, but so is Firefox on iOS. I started trying different browsers on my desktop over the last week due to the firing of James Damore from Google. 

After downloading Firefox Focus (which is fantastic for private browsing), I decided to download Firefox too on my iPhone. I havenâ€™t used it since 2011 on the desktop. 

I was very impressed at how Firefox has improved so much over the years. The first thing I noticed is that it was much smoother and slicker than it used to be. Secondly (and one of the main reasons I moved to Chrome in the first place) is that it now has a great bookmark synchronisation feature. The fact that I donâ€™t have to use a 3rd party bookmark sync service like xmarks is great. I never liked thos1e clunky Firefox add-ons from 3rd parties and the extensions store still looks pretty bad even in 2017.

One of the best things I noticed when I looked at the Mozilla website was that they also have Pocket as a bookmarking product. I have heard of pocket before but the fact that it is owned by Mozilla and the fact that I could sign up for it using my Firefox account was a bonus. I started using it within 10 minutes of using Firefox and I love pocket. It is a much better service than Delicious and I may even subscribe for the premium version if I start to integrate Pocket into my workflow 100% (all new habits take time!)

Overall, well done Firefox. The massive improvements made over the years will ensure that I start to use Firefox daily for work and especially Pocket as a personal and work content repository.

Needs Improvements. The bookmarks section is spectacularly anti intuitive. It doesn't allow for new bookmarks to be placed in folders, nor can you create bookmark folders from within the app. In fact there are no folders at all unless you sync FF with your desktop. If you do sync FF with your desktop, you'll have access to the bookmarks folders created on your desktop, but the app still doesn't allow new bookmarks to be placed inside these folders, placing them instead in a separate Mobile Bookmarks folder. The "native" folders, namely Bookmarks Menu, Bookmarks Toolbar, Mobile Bookmarks and Unsorted Bookmarks, are all inside the Desktop Bookmarks folder and can neither be renamed, deleted or edited in any way rendering them useless. Yes, you read that right: There's an Unsorted Bookmarks folder that you cannot sort, and the Mobile Bookmarks folder is inside the Desktop Bookmarks folder. 

The app is also incapable of playing video content from the BBC.

A third improvement would be that the Reading View presents the article full screen as the "banner" above is too big in an iPhone screen.

Other than that it's a great browser. Keep up the good work!

Ottima app. Ho atteso a lungo che Firefox arrivasse su IOS e per fortuna non ha deluso. Mancano ancora parecchie funzioni ma essendo una new entry posso capirlo.

Great for sync for bookmarks on the go. I bookmark lots of crap. And it's nice to whip those up anytime and show family or friends on my phone when I visit them. And vice versa, it's nice to bookmark something I find on mobile and then retrieve it later on desktop.

Great mobile browser. I would recommend this as an alternative to Safari. Some sites don't function as well on certain browsers, so it's good to have a backup. I also like the innovation of night mode in a recent update.

Broken - Fix iOS Bookmarks Can't Sort or Move. Hey iOS developers. Thanks for the hard work you do, but when are you going to fix bookmarks on the iOS platform? Great concept the idea of synced bookmarks across Firefox on multiple platforms. Implementation is poor however. All iOS Firefox can seem to do is dump mobile saved bookmarks into one location underneath the Desktop folder. The folder labeled Mobile Bookmarks will show no bookmarks whatsoever. I have seen questions going back to years on this topic and yet no one seems to address it. Why?

Guys, let's talk.   Ever since Chrome was introduced, I've been trying and trying to advocate for the old favorite. And for the most part, it didn't work. Slowly, Chrome started winning, while Firefox still looked like the 90s. Even with the Aurora update, it still felt wrong (and not just because it was a carbon copy of Chrome's interface). But this? Quantum?? You guys have a very interesting beast on your hands now. It's fast, it's smooth, and it almost has a built in ad blocker (cheers!).   That said, one small quirk that I'll also report through TestFlight with the iOS beta (also absolutely gorgeous, by the way): the full screen scrolling doesn't hide the navigation controls. If that's intentional, then why? Your full screen was fine before. Don't break it now.   Keep being awesome, guys.

Hello, Firefox! You guys are my favorite browser. At first it was that cute fox logo (no one else had animal friends) but as I learned more about you over the years, it became about your product and purpose (and the fox, he's still playing a major role!). Even your donation requests have become one of my favorite things. I'm writing with feedback, a request.... Once one travels with an iPad instead of a MacBook Pro, it's difficult to throw that heavy beast of a machine back into your bag, ever again. So my iPad Pro has become my #1 work, life, and communication device - I even use it more than my iPhone. So of course, I want to use my number one browser with my number one machine! It's not perfect, but it's pretty great. Except when I am jumping onto Firefox for iOS, because there is no way to organize bookmarks. Categorize them? Move them? Alphabatize them? Nothing. The only solution is to wipe them all out and re-enter them one by one, in a preffered order. And yes, I've done that. But then, inevitably, comes along a new site to bookmark and the process restarts. Please, if it's not too much trouble, give us power over our bookmarks in Firefox for iOS! Free them to be organized and color coded, so that Martha Stewart and I can breathe again, and have a happier browsing experience! Thanks!

Just read about the decission to add Cliqz to every 100 download and I have to say this is making me rethink if Firefox can remain the browser I use and recommend.  This is wrong on so many levels, starts with randomly inserting stuff into a download which I think is extremely unprofessional and even more worrying sneakingly adding the kind of stuff which is the main reason for me to not use the incumbent, preinstalled browsers.   Why should people spend time to install a 3rdparty browser (and to write lengthy responses as I do just now) if what they get is the same as whats on their machine already? Firefox should be an alternative and not a copy! I read your announcements re. speed improvements which we will get soon, but honestly this doesn't matter much to me, the current FF release does a good enough job in terms of speed. Today it's Firefox, tomorrow it's another one which will be fastest.   What I want is an alternative approach, and I thought this is Firefox. But adding more and more stuff, especially privacy affecting stuff like Cliqz, is the exact opposite of what I want from an alternative. Ride the GDPR wave and be the privacy respecting alternative and not yet another bloated copy of Chrome, Safari, etc, which randomly and sneakingly add stuff which no one asked for.  I have to say I am getting very worried about where Firefox is going! And judging by the newsgroups I follow this latest Cliqz decision is already turning into a marketing disaster...  Thomas@gifzly.de
